intro: Paronychia carica var. carica, commonly known as the common goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it typically grows in moist, disturbed soils. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
